incidents.name: Sending emails is not working for newly created projects that are using the build-in SMTP provider.

incident_updates.body: Things continue to be stable, and we believe this issue to be resolved.

A fix has been implemented, and the default SMTP provider should be working without any issues now.

Please contact https://supabase.help if you're still facing issues.
We are still progressing with rolling out the fix for this issue. It will soon again be possible for projects to send outbound SMTP traffic via IPv4 for our built-in SMTP provider
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Projects created after 29th January 0600UTC are not able to send emails (e.g. invites) using the build-in SMTP provider. Switching to a custom email provider like resend (https://resend.com/overview) that supports IPv6 fixes the issue as a workaround (https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp).
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Storage service unavailable in multiple regions / New Projects Unable to Connect to Supavisor

incident_updates.body:
We have rolled out a fix for the Storage side, but in the process, discovered that Supavisor is affected by the same issue. This is resulting in newly created projects being unable to connect to Supavisor. Existing projects are unaffected.

We're working on getting a fix out for new projects on supavisor now.
We've found the issue and are currently in the process of rolling out a fix to all regions.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Supabase Logs is experiencing unexpected downtime

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We identified the issue and issued a fix, log functionality has returned and we will continue to monitor for some time.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Logs Currently Unavailable in the Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've identified what we believe to be the issue and are working on a fix.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: elevated edge functions errors in us-east-1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issues launching new projects in eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-central-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issues with Realtime Connectivity

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified the components causing the issues with Realtime, and are working on a solution now.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Supabase Logs is experiencing degraded performance

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All traffic has now been shifted to the new logging cluster, and error rates have returned to normal.

We are continuing to monitor in the event of any further issues.

The Supabase logging infrastructure was in a degraded state. We rolled out a fix and things should begin to stabilise.

You may notice degraded log ingestion and queries for a short while during the transition.

We will continue to monitor the logging infrastructure to ensure stability.
We have noticed an issue with Supabase Logs and are currently investigating. Customers may experience delays on search/view logs.

incidents.name: Some Edge Functions Disrupted with Error Code 1101

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have backported the fix to all existing projects and are monitoring the situation.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the situation.

We are advising users experiencing this issue to operate an update against their project's edge function secrets in order to fully regenerate the project's function metadata's contents.
We have identified the issue and are working on a fix. The issue happens when secrets for a project are set before deploying any functions.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Sporadic errors in starting up Postgres

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
us-east-1 and eu-central-1 have also been patched, which completes the rollout of the fix.

us-west-1, us-west-2 have been patched.

Rollout is continuing to us-east-1 and eu-central-1, and the recommendation against restarts and upgrades in those regions still applies.

If your project is located in a region that has already been patched per this page, you should be able restart/upgrade without issues.
ca-central-1 and sa-east-1 have been patched. Rollout is continuing to remaining regions, and recommendations against restarts and upgrades still applies.

The rollout of the fix is still in progress.

For the time being, we still recommend against restarting or upgrading your projects until this is resolved.
The fix has been completed in eu-west-1 and eu-west-2. It is currently rolling out to eu-central-1.

The jobs rolling out the fix are progressing slower than expected, and as a result, Europe regions are still under way.

We will start rolling this out to other regions once they are complete.

The fix is still rolling out to eu-west regions, and things are progressing normally.

We will continue to update on progress as regions complete and we start rolling things out in new regions.

The fix has begun rolling out on eu-west-1 and eu-west-2. 

Rollout on ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, and ap-south-1 is complete.

The fix is currently running through ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, and ap-south-1. More regions will follow as these complete.

As a reminder, until the fix has been rolled out completely, we recommend not restarting your project, or attempting an upgrade.
Fix has been rolled out to projects located in ap-northeast-1 and ap-northeast-2.

We've identified the root cause as an automated package upgrade, and are in the process of rolling out a fix. Until the fix has been rolled out completely, we recommend not restarting your project, or attempting an upgrade.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Unable to run queries in the Dashboard SQL Editor

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and we are working on a fix. Supabase Data APIs are not affected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increased Logging Infrastructure Error Rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

To alleviate the immediate issues, we've shifted logging traffic to new nodes, which are now up and running. Error rates have decreased, and things are looking stable now.

At this point, some logs may still be in queue to backfill, but things should be looking better when looking at and searching logs in the Dashboard.

The Supabase logging infrastructure is currently in a degraded state. This means that looking at or searching logs and some other metrics in the Dashboard may be slow or timeout. These data may also be behind, until this issue is resolved.

There is no impact to running projects, and any currently missing logs should populate as we stabilize the logging infrastructure.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Cloudflare API / DNS Propagation Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

All queues are looking good, and requests should be processing normally now.

If you continue to have any issues, please open up a ticket with our Support team: https://supabase.com/dashboard/support/new

Cloudflare is experiencing issues with its APIs, resulting in DNS propagation delays.

While the Cloudflare incident has been resolved, we are continuing to see some delays as request queues are worked through and are monitoring for any further issues. You can read more about the Cloudflare incident here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/vp0dwbjll8zf

Current services are unaffected; however the following may have slower-than-usual DNS Propagation:

New Project Creation
Project Compute Resize
Project Upgrades
Project Pause/Restore

We would recommend against making changes to project configurations until this is resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Newly created users are unable to access the Supabase Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Control Plane outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Traffic to existing projects is not affected. Creation of new projects, and updating properties of existing projects (e.g. auth rate limits) is partially disrupted.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issues creating new projects/restoring paused projects

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Project that were affected in the form of failed resumes have been reset to Paused, and can be resumed from the dashboard as needed.

Our quota has been increased. 

We've re-enabled project creation, and will be re-starting any project resume attempts that were blocked by this soon.

Active projects remain unaffected, and while it should work now, we'd still advise against pausing any instances until this issue is completely resolved.

We have run up against certain resource quotas in the us-east-1 Region and are working with our provider to extend these. We are also evaluating other options to restore project creation and resumption as soon as possible.

Currently active projects remain unaffected. We recommend against pausing any projects at this time.

We have identified the component preventing paused services from being resumed and preventing new project creation.

Currently active projects are unaffected. 

We're looking into possible fixes now.
We believe the issues are restricted to the us-east-1 region. Project creation/restores have been disabled until we've identified and resolved the issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Delayed DNS Propagation on New Projects due to Ongoing Cloudflare Issues

incident_updates.body: DNS Propagation has returned to normal, and we are seeing no lingering errors related to the Cloudflare Outage, which has also been resolved.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: We have worked with Cloudflare to get to the bottom of this, and a fix has been applied. We are monitoring for any further issues.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: We're again seeing issues in DNS propagation from Cloudflare.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare DNS propagation issues have subsided. Workflows that were impacted in the past should no longer see any disruptions.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare DNS propagation delays are once again impacting the creation of new projects, upgrades, and compute size changes. We're working with Cloudflare Support on this matter.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body:
DNS propagation speeds have returned to normal.

There might further disruptions until Cloudflare's incident is resolved and services are fully restored ( https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg ).

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body:
Status from Cloudflare remains the same - DNS Updates are still degraded. New project creation and other DNS-related operations will work; however, they may be slower than normal until things are all clear on the Cloudflare side.

We're continuing to monitor any changes here, and will update again as more information becomes available.

More info here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incident_updates.body:
This is related to the ongoing Cloudflare incident here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg and our earlier incident here: https://status.supabase.com/incidents/qm2zp5l61l4m

While the API requests to cloudflare are more stable, we are receiving reports that DNS propagation for new projects is taking longer than normal. Cloudflare also re-added DNS to their list of affected services, so we will be monitoring for changes and will update here as we have more information.

affected_components.name: Supabase Cloud - Cloudflare Cloudflare Authoritative DNS

incidents.name: DNS setup issues for new projects

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've re-enabled project creation and upgrade workflows, as Cloudflare's API has gotten to a stable point. We'll be working on rectifying any updates that failed during the period in question.

Error rates to Cloudflare APIs have improved, but remain unstable. The restoration efforts on their side continue, and we're continuing to monitor until error rates have returned to an acceptable range.

Cloudflare has a partial fix in place, and is in the process of bringing up more services. 

We are continuing to monitor Cloudflare status, and will update once we have more information.

We are continuing to monitor updates from Cloudflare. They are still working on restoring various services down due to a power failure in their data centers.

More info here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/hm7491k53ppg

We will update again as more information becomes available.

DNS changes are failing due to a Cloudflare outage ( https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/ ). This causes failures in the creation of new projects, and upgrades or compute add-on size changes to existing projects.

Existing projects are otherwise unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Dashboard query service is unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have identified the issue to be related to an operational change related to the Dashboard's query gateway. We are working on a fix now.

This issue affects only dashboard-based actions. Projects themselves are unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Cloudflare outage: Supabase data API services impacted

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Cloudflare has communicated the issue is solved on their end.
We are monitoring the situation on our end.
Some requests to Supabase services may fail due to an upstream outage with Cloudflare. More info: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/l6x2h1zp69bc
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Cloudflare outage: Supabase data API services impacted

incident_updates.body: Duplicate of https://status.supabase.com/incidents/1rcsdcwsfp8m
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issues connecting to Logflare - Dashboard logs impacted

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have identified the cause of the issue and have pushed a fix. 
We believe the connection issues to be resolved at this time, and logs should now be visible in the Dashboard.
We are still investigating the cause of the Logflare connectivity issues.

We are continuing to investigate the issue with Logflare connectivity. Users may be unable to see logs in their Supabase Dashboards until connectivity is restored. Connections to running projects and their services are unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Project creation impacted in the ap-southeast-1 (Singapore) region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

New project creation in apse1 should no longer be impacted.

If you were affected by this incident while creating a new project, you should be able to delete it and create a replacement.
A fix is being implemented.

Project creation is impacted in the ap-southeast-1 (Singapore) region.
Existing projects are unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issue querying logs and some metrics

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Resend SMTP certificate expired

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The certificate for resend.com's email service are expired, and is causing projects using their SMTP servers to fail email delivery.

We have reported the issue to Resend.

Note that this is not an issue with Supabase managed systems, and this message is here for informational purposes only. Please refer to https://resend-status.com/ for further updates.

incidents.name: Intermittent login issues due to errors from GitHub

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are receiving sporadic errors from GitHub during the login process
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Errors in sending Auth Emails using default SMTP provider

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We're working on a fix to the issue. Projects using a custom SMTP server are unaffected ( https://supabase.com/docs/guides/platform/going-into-prod )
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Management API and Dashboard outage in Asia and nearby regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're still investigating the root cause, but the API and dashboard are available at this time.
Existing projects are unaffected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Logflare is experiencing unexpected ingestion disruption, Supabase Logs may be affected

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Project creation unavailable across multiple regions

incident_updates.body:
The underlying issue has been resolved.

Paused projects that attempted a restore and failed due to this issue have been marked as paused, and can be restored as per usual from the dashboard.

New projects that failed to initialize due to this issue have been marked as removed, and a replacement project can be created from the dashboard.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Project creation in eu-central-1 and project unpausing in us-east-1 have been enabled again.
Project creation in us-east-1 has been enabled again.

We’re additionally observing issues with launching projects in eu-central-1.
Existing projects are not affected.

We are currently unable to launch up more projects in us-east-1 due to an observed issue with our cloud provider. Project creation in the region is temporarily disabled while we work with our cloud provider to address the issue. 
Existing projects are not affected.

We are currently unable to launch up more projects in us-east-1 due to an observed issue with our cloud provider. Project creation in the region is temporarily disabled while we work with our cloud provider to address the issue. 
Existing projects are not affected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Logflare experienced short unexpected downtime, logs and reporting may be affected

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Degraded performance in emails for organization invites and Supabase email account confirmations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Lowered SMTP rate limits for our default email service

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

SMTP rate limits for our default email service has been lowered.

If you require a higher limit, please use the Custom SMTP Server functionality ( https://supabase.com/docs/guides/platform/going-into-prod#availability ), which comes with user-controlled rate limits.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Scheduled Realtime Maintenance

New projects created since Tuesday and existing projects in regions: ap-northeast-2, ca-central-1, ap-southeast-2:eu-west-1:ap-northeast-1, are having issues with verifying phone OTPs. A fix is under way.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Impacted regions are: ap-southeast-2, eu-west-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ca-central-1
We are currently investigating this issue.
